primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does The Crusher land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race The Crusher? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. The Crusher scored 46 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: The Crusher. Upper Peninsula, Michigan. 62 mi. Rolling to hilly Upper Peninsula wilderness gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: The Crusher | Upper Peninsula, Michigan | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. The self-supported format eliminates expensive aid station infrastructure while delivering wilderness adventure through Michigan's most remote terrain. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Affordable. Won't break the bank. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Greg Gentle targeted "20 hours" for the 225-mile route, needing "about an average of 13 mph knowing there will be some stops along the way. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Proper climbing. You'll earn your descents. Hogback Mountain immediately forces hike-a-bike with "30-pound bikes up the mountain" in what Chris Spurrier calls a "rock scramble. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Adventure factor is real. Bears, river crossings, wilderness sections with zero cell service, and navigation by GPS through logging roads and jeep trails—it's adventure riding. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Chris Spurrier describes Hogback Mountain as "a rock scramble, carrying/pushing 30-pound bikes up the mountain. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. July through September in northern Michigan means everything from summer heat to early fall cold, often in the same ride.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Experience. 2 out of 5. A nice day on the bike. Nothing more. Logistics. 1 out of 5. You are the aid station. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Not exactly stacked.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: More challenging terrain than lower Michigan

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Extremely remote location (5+ hours from Detroit)
Tiny field with no competitive depth

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Marquette or Green Bay - varies, or Detroit 5+ hours
Lodging: Very limited lodging in Upper Peninsula. Look for nearby towns or camping.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Remote Wilderness Ride. Only if you're in the Upper Peninsula or planning UP tourism. Not worth the long drive for the race alone.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.
